title: Why Free Speech Is in Crisis on Campus: A Case Study
sub_head: A law professor thinks free speech is threatened not by students forcibly shutting down a speaker, but by criticism of those students.
body:
Prof. Rory Little at once exemplifies and exposes the illogic of cancel-culture norms at colleges and law-schools (“Open Minds, Loud Voices and Free Speech on Campus,” Letters, March 28). He thinks free speech is threatened not by students forcibly shutting down a speaker, but by “simplistic shutdown critiques” of the students’ acts in the aftermath. Those unhelpful critiques, the professor assures us, will not stifle “campus debate,” which continues at Hastings Law, albeit without the canceled speaker’s views. One shares Mark Antony’s lament: “Oh judgment, thou art fled to brutish beasts.”
Mark Van Brussel
